tools.name: request_missing_parameters
tools.description: Use this tool ONLY when required parameters for another tool are missing and cannot be reasonably defaulted. Provide the intended tool and the list of missing required parameter names.

intended_tool_name.description: The exact name of the tool the user likely intended to use (e.g., 'fetch_entity').

missing_params.description: A list of the exact names of REQUIRED parameters that are missing for the 'intended_tool_name'.

clarification_question.description: A clear question to ask the user to obtain the missing parameters, phrased from the assistant's perspective.

tools.name: fetch_emails
tools.description: Fetch Gmail emails with advanced filtering options based on criteria like sender, subject, date, labels, or attachments.

operation.description: Specifies the operation to perform, always 'fetch' for this tool.

backfillPeriodMs.description: Optional: How far back in time to search for emails, specified in milliseconds.

filters.description: Optional: A set of criteria to filter the emails.

sender.description: Filter by the sender's email address.

recipient.description: Filter by the recipient's email address.

subject.description: Filter by keywords or phrases in the email subject.

contains.description: Subject must contain ALL these keywords.

startsWith.description: Subject must start with this text.

endsWith.description: Subject must end with this text.

dateRange.description: Filter emails received within a specific date range.

after.description: Include emails received after this ISO 8601 timestamp.

before.description: Include emails received before this ISO 8601 timestamp.

hasAttachment.description: Filter for emails that have attachments.

labels.description: Filter by Gmail labels (e.g., INBOX, IMPORTANT, or custom labels).

includeBody.description: Whether to include the full email body in the result (can be large). Defaults to false.

excludeCategories.description: Gmail categories to exclude (e.g., Promotions, Social, Updates).

isRead.description: Filter based on read/unread status (true for read, false for unread).

isImportant.description: Filter for emails marked as important by Gmail.

includeSpam.description: Whether to include emails from the Spam folder. Defaults to false.

includeTrash.description: Whether to include emails from the Trash folder. Defaults to false.

limit.description: Maximum number of emails to return (default/max may vary).

offset.description: Number of emails to skip (for pagination).

subject.description: The subject line of the email.

body.description: The main content/body of the email.

tools.name: fetch_calendar_events
tools.description: Fetch Google Calendar events. Use operation 'fetch' for a single event by ID, or 'fetch_list' to query multiple events with date range filters and search.

operation.description: Use 'fetch' to get a single event by ID, or 'fetch_list' to query multiple events.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar. Defaults to 'primary'.

eventId.description: Required for operation 'fetch': The ID of the specific event to retrieve.

filters.description: Optional filters for operation 'fetch_list' to query multiple events.

timeMin.description: Start of time range (RFC3339 format, e.g., '2024-11-01T00:00:00Z').

timeMax.description: End of time range (RFC3339 format, e.g., '2024-11-30T23:59:59Z').

conditions.description: Additional filter conditions on event fields.

showDeleted.description: Include deleted events? Defaults to false.

singleEvents.description: Expand recurring events into instances? Defaults to true.

orderBy.description: Sort results by start time or last updated. Requires singleEvents=true for 'startTime'.

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return (max 2500).

q.description: Free text search query to find events.

updatedMin.description: Filter events modified after this timestamp.

tools.name: create_calendar_event
tools.description: Create a new event, meeting, or appointment in Google Calendar with full support for attendees, reminders, recurrence, and conference data.

operation.description: Use 'create' for a single event or 'batch_create' for multiple events.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar. Defaults to 'primary'.

location.description: Physical or virtual location of the event.

sendUpdates.description: Send calendar invitations to attendees? Defaults to 'none'.

conferenceDataVersion.description: Set to 1 to enable conference data creation.

tools.name: update_calendar_event
tools.description: Update existing Google Calendar event(s). Use 'update' for a single event or 'batch_update' for multiple events.

operation.description: Use 'update' for single event, 'batch_update' for multiple.

calendarId.description: The ID of the calendar. Defaults to 'primary'.

eventId.description: Required for 'update': The ID of the event to update.

fields.description: Fields to update for operation 'update'. Only provided fields will be changed.

sendUpdates.description: Notify attendees of changes? Defaults to 'none'.

tools.name: fetch_notion_page
tools.description: Fetch Notion pages or query database rows. Use operation 'fetch' for a single page by ID, or 'fetch_database' to query a database with filters and sorting.

operation.description: Use 'fetch' for a single page, 'fetch_database' to query database rows.

identifier.description: Required for 'fetch': The page ID (UUID format).

databaseId.description: Required for 'fetch_database': The database ID (UUID format).

tools.name: create_notion_page
tools.description: Create new Notion pages in a database or as child pages. Use 'create' for a single page or 'batch_create' for multiple pages.

operation.description: Use 'create' for single page, 'batch_create' for multiple.

properties.description: Page properties (key-value pairs). Values can be strings, numbers, booleans, or Notion property objects.

children.description: Content blocks to add to the page.

items.description: Page object (same structure as single create).

tools.name: update_notion_page
tools.description: Update existing Notion page(s) properties, archive status, icon, or cover. Use 'update' for a single page or 'batch_update' for multiple.

operation.description: Use 'update' for single page, 'batch_update' for multiple.

pageId.description: Required for 'update': The page ID to update.

properties.description: Properties to update (only specified properties will change).

tools.name: fetch_entity
tools.description: Fetch Salesforce records (Account, Contact, Lead, Deal, Article, Case) with optional identifier or advanced filtering. Supports single record fetch by ID/field or bulk queries with complex filters, sorting, aggregation, and pagination.

operation.description: The operation to perform. Must be 'fetch'.

entityType.description: The type of Salesforce object to fetch.

identifier.description: Optional: The specific ID or unique field value (like Name or Email based on entityType) to fetch a single record. Use 'all' to fetch multiple records (requires filters or uses defaults).

identifierType.description: Optional: Specifies which field the 'identifier' value refers to (e.g., 'Id', 'Name', 'Email'). Only needed if 'identifier' is provided and isn't an Id or 'all'.

filters.description: Optional: Advanced criteria for filtering records when fetching multiple. Required if 'identifier' is 'all' or omitted. Supports conditions, sorting, pagination, aggregation, and field selection.

field.description: The API name of the field to filter on. IMPORTANT: For fields on related objects, use dot notation, for example: 'Account.Name' or 'CreatedBy.Email'.

value.description: Single value for comparison (can be null).

values.description: Multiple values for 'in', 'notIn', 'between' operators (usually strings, numbers, booleans, or null).

conditions.description: List of filter conditions to apply to the query.

logic.description: Logical combination of conditions (e.g., '1 AND (2 OR 3)'). Defaults to AND if multiple conditions exist.

limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. Defaults usually apply (typically 200-2000).

offset.description: Number of records to skip (pagination offset).

includeFields.description: Specific Salesforce API field names to return. If omitted, default fields are returned.

excludeFields.description: Specific Salesforce API field names to exclude from results.

timeFrame.description: Predefined time frame for date filtering (e.g., 'last7days', 'thisMonth', 'lastYear').

groupBy.description: Fields for grouping results (used with aggregate functions).

aggregate.description: Aggregation functions for statistical queries (e.g., COUNT, SUM, AVG).

includeDeleted.description: Include deleted/archived records in results? Defaults to false.

fields.description: Optional: Specific Salesforce API field names to include in the results (alternative to 'filters.includeFields').

format.description: Response format: 'detailed' (normalized with metadata), 'simple' (minimal data), 'raw' (full Salesforce API response). Defaults to 'detailed'.

tools.name: create_entity
tools.description: Create a new Salesforce entity (Account, Contact, Lead, Deal, Article, or Case). Supports automatic field name mapping and batch operations with idempotency.

operation.description: The operation to perform. Must be 'create'.

entityType.description: The type of Salesforce entity to create.

record.description: Entity fields to set for creating a SINGLE record. Use either 'record' or 'fields' (they're aliases). Field names should match Salesforce API names (e.g., FirstName, LastName, Email, Company, Phone, Title, etc.).

fields.description: Alias for 'record'. Use for creating a SINGLE record. Key-value pairs of Salesforce fields for the new record.

items.description: Record object with Salesforce field names and values.

records.description: Use for creating MULTIPLE records in a batch (max 100). An array of record objects, each with Salesforce field names.

parentId.description: Optional parent record ID for creating child records or related entities (e.g., AccountId for creating a Contact under an Account).

idempotencyKey.description: Optional unique key for this request to prevent duplicate creation. Use consistent format: e.g., 'contact-john-doe-2025-11-20' or 'lead-acme-corp-2025-11-20'.

format.description: Response format: 'detailed' (with warnings and metadata), 'simple' (just success/id), 'raw' (full API response). Defaults to 'detailed'.

tools.name: update_entity
tools.description: Update existing Salesforce record(s) (Account, Contact, Lead, Deal, Article, Case). Supports single record updates by ID/field or batch updates with automatic field name mapping and idempotency.

operation.description: The operation to perform. Use 'update' for a single record, 'batch_update' for multiple records.

entityType.description: The type of Salesforce object to update.

identifier.description: Use for a SINGLE record update. The value used to find the record (e.g., a record ID, Name, or Email).

identifierType.description: The type of field the 'identifier' refers to. Defaults to 'Id' if not provided.

fields.description: Use for a SINGLE record update. Key-value pairs of Salesforce API field names and their new values. Only provided fields will be updated.

record.description: Alias for 'fields'. Use for a SINGLE record update. Key-value pairs of Salesforce API field names and their new values.

identifier.description: The value used to find the record (e.g., a record ID, Name, or Email).

identifierType.description: The type of field the 'identifier' refers to. Defaults to 'Id'.

fields.description: Key-value pairs of Salesforce API field names and their new values.

idempotencyKey.description: Optional unique key for this specific update to prevent duplicate operations.

records.description: Use for a BATCH update (max 100 records). An array of objects, each with an 'identifier', 'fields', and optional 'identifierType' and 'idempotencyKey'.

idempotencyKey.description: Optional unique key for this request to prevent duplicate updates. Use consistent format: e.g., 'update-contact-123-2025-11-20' or 'update-lead-acme-2025-11-20'.

format.description: Response format: 'detailed' (with warnings and metadata), 'simple' (just success status), 'raw' (full Salesforce API response). Defaults to 'detailed'.

tools.name: create_outlook_entity
tools.description: Create Outlook entities: Message, Event, or Contact. Supports field validation, sanitization, and automatic parent ID handling for nested entities.

entityType.description: The type of Outlook entity to create.

record.description: Entity fields. Aliases: 'record' or 'fields'. Field names match Microsoft Graph API names (e.g., subject, body, toRecipients, start, end, displayName, emailAddresses, etc.).

fields.description: Alias for 'record'. Key-value pairs of entity properties.

parentId.description: Optional parent record ID (e.g., folder ID for Message, calendar ID for Event, contact folder ID for Contact).

tools.name: update_outlook_entity
tools.description: Update Outlook entities: Message, Event, or Contact. Supports field validation and sanitization with patch operations.

entityType.description: The type of Outlook entity to update.

id.description: The ID of the entity to update.

patch.description: Fields to update. Only provided fields will be changed.

fields.description: Alias for 'patch'. Key-value pairs of fields to update.

tools.name: fetch_outlook_entity
tools.description: Fetch Outlook entities: Message, Event, Contact, MailFolder, Calendar, or Attachment. Supports ODATA filtering, pagination, and field selection.

entityType.description: The type of Outlook entity to fetch.

parentId.description: Optional parent ID (e.g., folder ID for Message, calendar ID for Event, message ID for Attachment). Required for Attachment.

filters.description: Optional ODATA filters for querying multiple entities.

format.description: Response format: 'detailed' (normalized), 'simple' (minimal), or 'raw' (API response). Defaults to 'detailed'.

tools.name: fetch_outlook_event_body
tools.description: Fetch the body content of an Outlook event. Returns event subject, body content, and content type (text or HTML).

eventId.description: The ID of the Outlook event to fetch body from.

calendarId.description: Optional calendar ID. If omitted, uses default calendar.
